newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian stocks see mild dip, Vilniaus active.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian stocks see mild dip, Vilniaus active.

text.p: Lithuanian shares saw a mild dip in light trade on Thursday, dealers said.
The official list was down 1.10 points to 879.09 points and group A slipped 4.30 points to 1855.59 points.
"I'm a bit less pessimistic than a week ago, with some good signs on the market and noticeable demand for some good stocks," said Kestutis Kupshys, a broker with Mendes Prior Europe.
But brokers admit that turnover still leaves something to be desired.
Central market turnover rose to a still unimpressive 541,000 litas from 376,000 litas. Turnover in block trades was about one million litas.
Vilniaus Bank continued to be active in block trades, turning over 918,000 litas at prices ranging from 228.00 litas to 230.00 litas.
Vilniuas Bank also traded at 225.00 litas on the central market, where its turnover was 40,000 litas.
Vilniaus Bank has slowly edged down close to the bottom of its usual trading range of 220.00 litas to 240.00 litas and brokers say its shares are now becoming attractive.
Brokers said brewer Kalnapilis, which edged up to 6.01 litas from 5.95 litas in trade of 27,000 litas, is also catching the eye of investors.
"Kalnapilis at the moment is quite interesting...they are increasing their share of the market and they will sell a lot (of beer) in the summer," one dealer said.
